lectoratest.name: Quiz - The risk of money laundering
lectoratest.subject: Test Results

question.name: Question 1
question.text: Which of the following is NOT an anti-money laundering obligation shared by reporting entities?
question.choices: Destroy business records periodically|Conduct customer identification and verification of identity|Report in relation to suspicious matters|Establish and maintain an AML/CTF program

question.name: Question 2
question.text: Which of the following is NOT a requirement for AML/CTF programs?
question.correctans: It must encourage employees to avoid customer due diligence where possible
question.choices: It must contain a ML/TF risk awareness training program|It must be approved and supervised by the Board and senior management|It must encourage employees to avoid customer due diligence where possible|It must be subject to an independent quality review from AUSTRAC

question.name: Question 3
question.text: Which of the following is true in relation to the tailored format of AML/CTF programs?
question.correctans: Reporting entities are best placed to assess the risks posed by their customers, products and services
question.choices: Customers are best placed to assess the risks posed by reporting entities' products and services|Reporting entities are best placed to assess the risks posed by their customers, products and services|It helps a reporting entity assess how to sell its products and services to customers|It helps criminal organisations avoid heavy penalties and liability

question.name: Question 4
question.text: Organisations should assess their ML/TF risk based on which of the following factors?
question.choices: Type of customer|Customers' source of funds and wealth|Control structure of corporate customers|All of the above

question.name: Question 5
question.text: Which of the following statements about beneficial owners is false?
question.correctans: They are thought to pose a low risk of money laundering
question.choices: They are thought to pose a low risk of money laundering |They are thought to pose a high risk of money laundering |They include people who control the corporate customer|They include people who own 25% or more of the corporate customer

question.name: Question 6
question.text: Which of the following statements about non-bank financial institutions is true?
question.choices: They handle cash transactions only|They do not include casinos|They are potentially extreme-risk customers|All of the above

question.name: Question 7
question.text: Before accepting a customer, what should reporting entities do?
question.correctans: Check both the DFAT blacklist and the Criminal Code Regulations
question.choices: Nothing. The customer is entitled to be dealt with impartially|Check both the DFAT blacklist and the Criminal Code Regulations|Check to see whether their competitors accepted the customer|Check the High Court lists

question.name: Question 8
question.text: Which the following is NOT a politically exposed person?
question.choices: A high-ranking member of the armed forces|A Federal court judge|A Head of State|A schoolteacher

question.name: Question 9
question.text: Which of the following statements about employees is true?
question.correctans: They could pose a significant risk of money laundering and terrorism financing to the organisation
question.choices: They pose no risk of money laundering and terrorism financing to the organisation |They could pose a significant risk of money laundering and terrorism financing to the organisation |They have no role to play in ensuring the organisation meets its anti-money laundering obligations|They must be exempted from scrutiny if assigned to high-risk areas or customers

question.name: Question 10
question.text: Which of the following does NOT suggest a high risk of money laundering?
question.correctans: The source of funds is a regular and known source
question.choices: The source of funds is a regular and known source|The source of funds is difficult to verify|The customer has income which is not employment-based or from a regular known source |Funds from several sources are deposited in the customer's account

question.name: Question 11
question.text: Fill in the blank. Collecting information is vital to ___ ML/TF risks.
question.correctans: \u2026 determining the nature of your business relationships and mitigating\u2026
question.choices: \u2026 endangering your business relationships and increasing your\u2026|\u2026 weakening the reputation of reporting entities and promoting the existence of\u2026|\u2026 determining the nature of your business relationships and mitigating\u2026|\u2026 strengthening the likelihood of\u2026

question.name: Question 12
question.text: What factor will NOT help you determine the control structure of a corporate customer?
question.correctans: The annual revenue of the parent company
question.choices: The number of people involved in the entity|The annual revenue of the parent company|Any contractual or family relationship between people involved in the entity|The nature and extent of any business

question.name: Question 13
question.text: Which of the following are designated service types?
question.choices: Trust accounts|Third party deposit/payment accounts|Transfer of cash into monetary instruments|All the above

question.name: Question 14
question.text: Complete the sentence. Countries with a low level of anti-money laundering regulation\u2026
question.correctans: \u2026 pose higher risks than countries with a high level of regulation
question.choices: \u2026 pose no risk to the international community|\u2026 pose a lower risk than countries with a high level of regulation|\u2026 pose higher risks than countries with a high level of regulation|\u2026 pose no risk of anti-money laundering

question.name: Question 15
question.text: Non-face to face delivery of a designated service will generally pose a greater level of ML/TF risk than face-to-face delivery. True or false?
